snippet: The agency said on Tuesday that its inspectors found unsanitary conditions at Roos Foods in Kenton, Del., including a badly leaking roof and rusting and deteriorating equipment.
abstract: Food and Drug Administration halts operations at Roos Foods, cheese plant in Kenton, Del, after outbreak of listeria linked to the company’s cheese killed one person and sickened seven others.
lead_paragraph: The agency said on Tuesday that its inspectors found unsanitary conditions at Roos Foods in Kenton, Del., including a badly leaking roof and rusting and deteriorating equipment.

headline.main: F.D.A. Shuts Cheese Plant After Listeria Death
headline.print_headline: F.D.A. Shuts Cheese Plant After Listeria Death
